answers.answer: Yeah my friend measured 4 weeks ahead n still delivered late just means your going to have a big baby doesn't mean that your due date will change
Oh the other thing she had to deliver by c-section due to baby being so big, midwife also didn't want her going over her due date either .. Even tho she did lol

Toward the end of my pregnancies, I measured ahead but my due date never changed. I went early with both of my boys. My first I was 38 weeks but measuring 41 weeks (he was 8lbs 4oz) and with my second, I was 36 weeks measuring around 38 weeks (he was 7lbs 2oz)  It just depends! Doesn't necessarily mean you will go early or late though. It's up to baby! :)

Thanks ladies! :) im hoping hes not too big and i am able to push him out lol...i dont want to have a C-Section. Im hoping he is good to me stays in there until atleast 38 weeks LOL! I dont want to have him on the 27th.

I measured very large with my daughter.  Enough was enough & they induced at 37 weeks.  It ended up being a c-section in the end.  I measured large during my entire pregnancy.  My daughter was 9 lbs 13 oz.  I also developed pre-eclampsia.  Due date doesn't change.Measuring large CAN lead to gestational diabetes, very large birth weight, pre-eclampsia among other things.  It is fine to measure large, just be sure they are monitering you.

question: Hey ladies...i was just wondering if its normal to measure ahead, but not have your due date changed?? Im measuring about 2 weeks ahead, but my Doctor says my due date will remain the same. Just curious to know if anyone was ahead and went past or delivered on time or delievered before their due date??
title: Is it normal to measure ahead??
